alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; Sherman; Valley; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 2:36PM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...QUICK HIT OF SNOW THIS AFTERNOON, FOLLOWED BY SOME BLOWING SNOW INTO TONIGHT AND THEN MORE BITTERLY COLD WIND CHILLS... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory through early Friday morning, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 2 inches, but with north-northwest winds gusting as high as 30 to 35 MPH even after snow ends. For the Wind Chill Advisory this evening into Friday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory for Friday evening into Saturday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 again expected, although wind speeds will only be around 10 MPH or less. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Friday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...All falling, accumulating snow will end by 6 PM today, if not a few hours sooner. However,north-northwest winds will remain gusty through the night, likely causing at least minor blowing and drifting snow issues. Fortunately, wind gusts will gradually drop off to around 20 MPH or less by sunrise Friday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Fillmore; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Polk; Sherman; Valley; York
